title: Osiris
creator: Conversion script
added_lines: '''Osiris''' ({{lang-grc|Ὄσιρις}}, also '''Usiris'''; the [[Egyptian language]] name is variously transliterated '''Asar''', '''Asari''', '''Aser''', '''Ausar''', '''Ausir''', '''Wesir''', '''Usir''', '''Usire''' or '''Ausare''') was an [[Egyptian mythology|Egyptian god]], usually identified as the god of the Afterlife, the underworl [[Geb]],<ref name=Wilkinson>{{cite book |author=Wilkinson, Richard H. |title=The complete gods and goddesses of ancient Egypt |publisher=Thames & Hudson |location=London |year=2003 |pages=105 |isbn=0-500-05120-8 |oclc= |doi=}}</ref> and the sky goddess [[Nut (goddess)|Nut] as being brother and husband of [[Isis]], with [[Horus]] being considered his posthumously begotten son.<ref name=Wilkinson /> He was also associated with the epithet '''[[Khenti-Amentiu]]''', which means ''"Foremost of the Westerners"'' — a reference to his kingship in the land of the dead.<ref>"How to Read Egyptian Heiroglyphs", Mark Collier & Bill Manley, British Museum Press, p. 41, 1998, ISBN 0 7141 1910 5</ref> As ruler of the dead, Osiris was also sometimes called "''king of the living''", since the Ancient Egyptians considered the blessed dead "''the living ones''".<ref>"Conceptions of God In Ancient Egypt: The One and the Many", Erik Hornung (translated by John Baines), p. 233, Cornell University Press, 1996, ISBN 10-8014-8384-0</ref>
deleted_lines:
'''Osiris''' ({{lang-grc|Ὄσιρις}}, also '''Usiris'''; the [[Egyptian language]] name is variously transliterated '''Asar''', '''Asari''', '''Aser''', '''Ausar''', '''Ausir''', '''Wesir''', '''Usir''', '''Usire''' or '''Ausare''') was an [[Egyptian mythology|Egyptian god]], usually identified as the god of the Afterlife, the underworld and the dead.

Osiris was at times considered the oldest son of the Earth god [[Geb]],<ref name=Wilkinson>{{cite book |author=Wilkinson, Richard H. |title=The complete gods and goddesses of ancient Egypt |publisher=Thames & Hudson |location=London |year=2003 |pages=105 |isbn=0-500-05120-8 |oclc= |doi=}}</ref> and the sky goddess [[Nut (goddess)|Nut] as being brother and husband of [[Isis]], with [[Horus]] being considered his posthumously begotten son.<ref name=Wilkinson /> He was also associated with the epithet '''[[Khenti-Amentiu]]''', which means ''"Foremost of the Westerners"'' — a reference to his kingship in the land of the dead.<ref>"How to Read Egyptian Heiroglyphs", Mark Collier & Bill Manley, British Museum Press, p. 41, 1998, ISBN 0 7141 1910 5</ref> As ruler of the dead, Osiris was also sometimes called "''king of the living''", since the Ancient Egyptians considered the blessed dead "''the living ones''".<ref>"Conceptions of God In Ancient Egypt: The One and the Many", Erik Hornung (translated by John Baines), p. 233, Cornell University Press, 1996, ISBN 10-8014-8384-0</ref>

title: Alberto_Del_Rio
creator: WikiDanilo666
added_lines: On the June 25, 2010 episode of ''[[WWE SmackDown|SmackDown]]'', Dos Caras, Jr. debuted on a pre-taped promo as the unmasked Alberto Del Rio, claiming to be the "only real honest man".<ref name=DelRioDebut>{{cite web|url= http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwesmackdownreport/article_42187.shtml|title=Parks' WWE SmackDown report 6/25: Ongoing "virtual time" coverage of the show, including Kane vs. Punk in No-DQ match|date=2010-06-25|accessdate=2010-06-26|work=Pro Wrestling Torch|last=Parks|first=Greg}}</ref> Thereafter, a vignette aired every week on ''SmackDown'' hyping his debut until the August 20 edition of ''SmackDown'' where he debuted as a heel, defeating [[Rey Mysterio, Jr.|Rey Mysterio]] in the main event via submission.<ref name=SmackDown082010>{{cite web|url= http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwesmackdownreport/article_43266.shtml|title=Parks' WWE SmackDown report 8/20: Ongoing "virtual time" coverage of the show, including Kane's reason for attacking Undertaker |date=2010-08-20|accessdate=2010-08-21|work=Pro Wrestling Torch|last=Parks|first=Greg}}</ref> The following week, Del Rio continued the storyline with Mysterio by attacking him after his match with [[Kane (wrestler)|Kane]], putting him on the shelf with a storyline injury.<ref>{{cite web|url= http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwesmackdownreport/article_43406.shtml|title=Parks' WWE SmackDown report 8/27: Ongoing "virtual time" coverage of the show, including the return of The Undertaker|date=2010-08-27|accessdate=2010-08-30|work=Pro Wrestling Torch|last=Parks|first=Greg}}</ref> Two weeks later he defeated [[Matt Hardy]] via submission to remain undefeated.<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.wrestleview.com/viewnews.php?id=1284217593|title=Smackdown Results - 9/10/11|date=2010-09-11|accessdate=2010-10-01|work=WrestleView|last=Tedesco|first=Mike}}</ref> The following week Del Rio received a challenge from Christian for a match at [[Night of Champions (2010)|Night of Champions]], but declined.<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.wrestleview.com/viewnews.php?id=1284830435|title=Smackdown Results - 9/17/11|date=2010-09-18|accessdate=2010-10-01|work=WrestleView|last=Tedesco|first=Mike}}</ref> On the September 24 edition of ''SmackDown'', Del Rio attacked Christian and injured him the same way he did Rey Mysterio the previous month.<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.wrestleview.com/viewnews.php?id=1285430966|title=Smackdown Results - 9/24/11|date=2010-09-25|accessdate=2010-10-01|work=WrestleView|last=Tedesco|first=Mike}}</ref> This was done to write Christian out of ''SmackDown'', as he had suffered a torn pectoral muscle.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://wrestleview.com/viewnews.php?id=1285274639|title=Report: Christian suffers injury, out for six months|last=Martin|first=Adam|date=2010-09-23|work=WrestleView|accessdate=2010-10-01}}</ref> Mysterio returned on the October 8 edition of ''SmackDown'' and handed Del Rio his first loss in the main event.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwesmackdownreport/article_44380.shtml|title=Parks' WWE SmackDown report 10/8: Ongoing "virtual time" coverage of the show, including Rey Mysterio vs. Alberto Del Rio|last=Parks|first=Greg|date=2010-10-08|work=Pro Wrestling Torch|accessdate=2010-10-09}}</ref> On the October 15 edition of ''SmackDown'', Del Rio defeated [[Chris Masters]] to earn a spot on Team SmackDown at [[Bragging Rights (2010)|Bragging Rights]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwesmackdownreport/article_44550.shtml|title=Parks' WWE SmackDown report 10/15: Ongoing "virtual time" coverage of the show, including Undertaker's "return" (again)|date=2010-10-15|last=Parks|first=Greg|accessdate=2010-10-17|work=Pro Wrestling Torch}}</ref> At the pay-per-view, Del Rio was eliminated from the interpromotional tag team match by Team Raw's [[CM Punk]].  on the October 29th episode of [[Smackdown]], he showed signs of a face turn by interrupting and attacking Kane.  He fought in a triple threat match against both [[Edge]] and [[Rey Mysterio]], but came up short, as [[Adam Copeland|Edge]] took the win.  During the match he shifted most of his attacks on Rey Mysterio and used underhanded tactics, thus turning him back to heel.<ref>{{cite web| url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/PPVReports/2010/10/25/15816946.html|title=Cena central to Bragging Rights; Smackdown wins again|last=Sokol|first=Bryan|date=2010-10-25|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]|accessdate=2010-10-30}}</ref>
deleted_lines: On the June 25, 2010 episode of ''[[WWE SmackDown|SmackDown]]'', Dos Caras, Jr. debuted on a pre-taped promo as the unmasked Alberto Del Rio, claiming to be the "only real honest man".<ref name=DelRioDebut>{{cite web|url= http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwesmackdownreport/article_42187.shtml|title=Parks' WWE SmackDown report 6/25: Ongoing "virtual time" coverage of the show, including Kane vs. Punk in No-DQ match|date=2010-06-25|accessdate=2010-06-26|work=Pro Wrestling Torch|last=Parks|first=Greg}}</ref> Thereafter, a vignette aired every week on ''SmackDown'' hyping his debut until the August 20 edition of ''SmackDown'' where he debuted as a heel, defeating [[Rey Mysterio, Jr.|Rey Mysterio]] in the main event via submission.<ref name=SmackDown082010>{{cite web|url= http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwesmackdownreport/article_43266.shtml|title=Parks' WWE SmackDown report 8/20: Ongoing "virtual time" coverage of the show, including Kane's reason for attacking Undertaker |date=2010-08-20|accessdate=2010-08-21|work=Pro Wrestling Torch|last=Parks|first=Greg}}</ref> The following week, Del Rio continued the storyline with Mysterio by attacking him after his match with [[Kane (wrestler)|Kane]], putting him on the shelf with a storyline injury.<ref>{{cite web|url= http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwesmackdownreport/article_43406.shtml|title=Parks' WWE SmackDown report 8/27: Ongoing "virtual time" coverage of the show, including the return of The Undertaker|date=2010-08-27|accessdate=2010-08-30|work=Pro Wrestling Torch|last=Parks|first=Greg}}</ref> Two weeks later he defeated [[Matt Hardy]] via submission to remain undefeated.<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.wrestleview.com/viewnews.php?id=1284217593|title=Smackdown Results - 9/10/11|date=2010-09-11|accessdate=2010-10-01|work=WrestleView|last=Tedesco|first=Mike}}</ref> The following week Del Rio received a challenge from Christian for a match at [[Night of Champions (2010)|Night of Champions]], but declined.<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.wrestleview.com/viewnews.php?id=1284830435|title=Smackdown Results - 9/17/11|date=2010-09-18|accessdate=2010-10-01|work=WrestleView|last=Tedesco|first=Mike}}</ref> On the September 24 edition of ''SmackDown'', Del Rio attacked Christian and injured him the same way he did Rey Mysterio the previous month.<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.wrestleview.com/viewnews.php?id=1285430966|title=Smackdown Results - 9/24/11|date=2010-09-25|accessdate=2010-10-01|work=WrestleView|last=Tedesco|first=Mike}}</ref> This was done to write Christian out of ''SmackDown'', as he had suffered a torn pectoral muscle.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://wrestleview.com/viewnews.php?id=1285274639|title=Report: Christian suffers injury, out for six months|last=Martin|first=Adam|date=2010-09-23|work=WrestleView|accessdate=2010-10-01}}</ref> Mysterio returned on the October 8 edition of ''SmackDown'' and handed Del Rio his first loss in the main event.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwesmackdownreport/article_44380.shtml|title=Parks' WWE SmackDown report 10/8: Ongoing "virtual time" coverage of the show, including Rey Mysterio vs. Alberto Del Rio|last=Parks|first=Greg|date=2010-10-08|work=Pro Wrestling Torch|accessdate=2010-10-09}}</ref> On the October 15 edition of ''SmackDown'', Del Rio defeated [[Chris Masters]] to earn a spot on Team SmackDown at [[Bragging Rights (2010)|Bragging Rights]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwesmackdownreport/article_44550.shtml|title=Parks' WWE SmackDown report 10/15: Ongoing "virtual time" coverage of the show, including Undertaker's "return" (again)|date=2010-10-15|last=Parks|first=Greg|accessdate=2010-10-17|work=Pro Wrestling Torch}}</ref> At the pay-per-view, Del Rio was eliminated from the interpromotional tag team match by Team Raw's [[CM Punk]]. He fought on the October 29th episode of [[Smackdown]] in a triple threat match against both [[Edge]] and [[Rey Mysterio]], but came up short, as [[Adam Copeland|Edge]] took the win.<ref>{{cite web| url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/PPVReports/2010/10/25/15816946.html|title=Cena central to Bragging Rights; Smackdown wins again|last=Sokol|first=Bryan|date=2010-10-25|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]|accessdate=2010-10-30}}</ref>

title: Theories_about_Alexander_the_Great_in_the_Quran
creator: Shahirshamsir
added_lines: Alexander the Great features prominently in early Arabic literature. There are many surviving versions of the ''Alexander romance'' in Arabic that were written after the conquest of Islam. It is also thought that pre-Islamic [[Arabic]] versions of the ''Alexander romance'' may have existed.<ref name=doufikar-aertis>Doufikar-Aerts, Faustina (2003). ''The Last Days of Alexander in an Arabic Popular Romance of Al-Iskandar.'' in ''The Ancient Novel and Beyond'' by Panayotakis, Zimmerman and Keulen.</ref>
deleted_lines: Alexander the Great features prominently in early Arabic literature. There is evidence of a lost pre-Islamic [[Arabic]] translation of the ''Alexander romance'' that was intermediate between the [[Syriac]] Christian and [[Ethiopic]] Christian translations, as well as later Persian translations<ref name=doufikar-aertis>Doufikar-Aerts, Faustina (2003). ''The Last Days of Alexander in an Arabic Popular Romance of Al-Iskandar.'' in ''The Ancient Novel and Beyond'' by Panayotakis, Zimmerman and Keulen.</ref> There are many surviving versions of the ''Alexander romance'' in Arabic but they are sufficiently different from the Syriac Christian legends that they cannot be called direct recensions or translations.

'''William E. "Bill" Brady, Jr.''' (born May 15, 1961, [[Bloomington, Illinois]]) is a [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]] member of the [[Illinois Senate]], representing the 44th Legislative District since his appointment in May 2002.  He previously served in the [[Illinois House of Representatives]], representing the 88th District from 1993 to 2000.

In 2006, he ran for [[Governor of Illinois]], finishing third in the Republican primary getting about 18% of the vote.<ref name="sjr-gov-brady">{{Cite news| url = http://archives.chicagotribune.com/2008/nov/07/local/chi-ap-il-governor-brady | title = Bill Brady says he will run for governor | author = [[State Journal-Register]] via [[Associated Press]] | date = 2008-11-07 | accessdate = 2009-01-30 | work=Chicago Tribune}}</ref>  Brady announced that he would be a candidate for Governor of Illinois again in 2010.<ref name="sjr-gov-brady" />

Brady announced his candidacy for the [[Illinois gubernatorial election, 2010|position of governor of Illinois in 2010]] and defeated his closest competitor, State Senator [[Kirk Dillard]], by 193 votes in the GOP primary. Brady faces incumbent Governor [[Pat Quinn (politician)|Pat Quinn]] and [[Rich Whitney]] of the Green Party in November.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.centerforpolitics.org/crystalball/ |title=Larry J. Sabato's Crystal Ball |publisher=Centerforpolitics.org |date= |accessdate=2010-07-30}}</ref>  Brady's running mate is twenty-eight-year-old [[Jason Plummer (politician)|Jason Plummer]], past Chairman of the [[Madison County, Illinois|Madison County]] Republican Party, and presently{{fact|date=October 2010}} an [[intelligence officer]] in the [[U.S. Naval Reserve]]. Plummer has been employed for several years as a vice president in his father's lumber business.<ref>{{cite news | url = http://articles.chicagotribune.com/2010-02-04/news/1002031031_1_watson-lumber-heritage-foundation | date = 2010-02-04 (corrected 2010-04-05) | first = Ray | last = Long | work = ChicagoTribune.com | publisher = Tribine Company | location = Chicago | accessdate = 2010-10-29 }}</ref>

==Personal==
{{Unreferenced section|date=August 2010}}
Bill Brady was born May 15, 1961, in [[Bloomington, Illinois]]. He graduated from [[Central Catholic High School (Bloomington, Illinois)|Central Catholic High School]] and [[Illinois Wesleyan University]]. Bill and his wife, Nancy, have three children and own a home in Bloomington.

==Career==
A millionaire real estate developer and broker,<ref>Chicago Tribune, Tribute Poll, Brady Holds Slim Lead over Quinn, Sept 2010, http://newsblogs.chicagotribune.com/clout_st/2010/09/tribune-poll-brady-holds-slim-lead-over-quinn.html</ref>  Brady is a co-owner of Brady Homes, one of Central Illinois’ largest home builders, founded by his father, Bill Brady Sr.<ref>Chicago Tribune, Inside Republican Governor Candidate Bill Brady's Business Deals, May 22, 2010, http://newsblogs.chicagotribune.com/clout_st/2010/05/inside-republican-governor-candidate-bill-bradys-business-deals.html</ref> Brady's financial statements and other sources indicate that he owns a [[Days Inn]] motel in [[Danville, Illinois]], a [[ReMax]] realty agency, an Amish furniture store, a [[Fort Lauderdale, Florida]] condominium and an interest in the [[Bloomington Extreme]], a Bloomington, Illinois professional indoor football team.<ref>Financial Disclosure Statement (2006) of Bill Brady to Illinois Secretary of State, http://projects.publicintegrity.org/docs/oi/2006%5CIL_2006_LEG%5C010672-2006.pdf</ref><ref name="trib-profile"/><ref>Brady Homes website, http://bradyhomes.com/about/history.php</ref><ref>ReMax Choice website, http://www.realtorschoice.net/</ref> With the economic downturn starting in 2007, in recent years his home building company has cut 75 percent of its staff and his realty company cut 50 percent of its staff. Because of his business' losses during this time, he paid no federal or state income taxes in 2008 and 2009.<ref>ChicagoNow,April 24 2010, http://www.chicagonow.com/blogs/public-affairs-jeff-berkowitz/2010/04/il-gov-candidate-sen-bradys-income-tax-returns-a-big-story.html</ref>

Brady has founded and operates several businesses, mostly focused in the areas of housing development and marketing. He is involved with the local, state and [[National Association of Realtors]], McLean County Chamber of Commerce, and Home Builders Association.

===Legislative assignments===
Committees on Insurance, (minority spokesperson); Pensions and Investments, (minority spokesperson); Public Health; Revenue; Commission on Government Forecasting and Accountability; Select Committee on Public Pension Investments

===Community involvement===
'''Present''':{{When|date=March 2010}} St. Joseph Hospital Community Board, Westminster Retirement Village Board, and Catholic Charities [[Roman Catholic Diocese of Peoria|Diocese of Peoria]].

'''Past''': United Way Board Campaign Chairman, Illinois Wesleyan Association Board, [[Heartland Community College]] Foundation Board, Diocese of Peoria Lay Board, [[Susan G. Komen for the Cure|Susan G. Komen]] Board,{{Clarify|date=March 2010}}<!-- National or local board? --> Illinois State University Business College Advisory Board, Central Catholic High School Foundation Board, and YMCA Board.{{Clarify|date=August 2010}}<!-- national/state/local YMCA? -->

==Political positions==
===Budget===
According to his campaign website, Brady believes in balancing the budget and paying down debt by "deconstructing Illinois spending and constructing a new budget, based on efficiency and priorities".{{Citation needed|date=August 2010}} He has proposed a plan to cut “a dime for every dollar” in state spending. But depending on the starting point, that may cut $3 billion to $5 billion from the $13 billion deficit.<ref>Brady, Quinn plans offer little remedy to budget deficit, Pantagraph.com, Oct. 10, 2010, http://www.pantagraph.com/news/local/government-and-politics/elections/article_bbff5ade-d414-11df-86e1-001cc4c03286.html</ref>

===Education===
Brady supports replacing the [[Illinois State Board of Education]] with a smaller agency that receives half of the current $80 million funding, or $40 million.<ref name="trib-profile">Chicago Tribune, Profile, Illinois State Sen Bill Brady, Jan 18, 2010, http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/elections/chi-brady-profilejan18,0,4311935.story {{Dead link|date=August 2010}}</ref><ref>Quincy Whig Herald, Bill Brady GOP Gubernatorial Nominee, Aug 9 2010, http://www.whig.com/story/news/Bill-Brady-081010?utm_source=twitterfeed&utm_medium=twitter</ref>

Brady believes that [[intelligent design]], which he has described as "in other words, teaching the [[Bible]]", should be taught in [[public school (government funded)|public schools]], saying that "we should teach the Bible in our schools.  One of the basic, fundamental voids we have in our school system is bringing God into the system."  In a follow-up interview, he explained: "I certainly believe that local school boards should have the opportunity to teach kids about the Bible, just as they ought to be able to teach them about the [[Koran]]."  He added: "I believe in [[school prayer]].  I think that local [[school board]]s should be able to dictate that they start the day with prayer."<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.robsherman.com/news/2010/03/15.htm |title=Brady wants religion taught in Illinois public schools |publisher=Robsherman.com |date=2005-10-20 |accessdate=2010-07-30}}  Cites an October 20, 2005 Springfield ''[[State Journal-Register]]'' story by Bernard Schoenburg that includes an interview with Brady and also parts of a Brady interview with Jim Leach of [[WMAY (AM)]].</ref><ref>{{Cite news| url = http://articles.chicagotribune.com/2010-03-07/news/ct-met-brady-quinn-governor-20100306_1_illinois-harsher-light-grips/3 | title = Bill Brady finds himself standing in a harsher light | first = Rick | last = Pearson | date = 2010-03-07 | work = [[Chicago Tribune]] | archiveurl = http://newsblogs.chicagotribune.com/clout_st/2010/03/republican-governor-nominee-bill-brady-under-greater-scrutiny.html | archivedate = 2010-03-06 <!-- yes, before the date on the print issue --> | accessdate = 2010-05-22 }}</ref>

Brady supports competition in elementary and secondary education and, "either through board action or citizens initiative", school districts funding the tuition to private schools, at a rate that is, at minimum, what the state provides to the school district.<ref>{{Cite news| url = http://elections.chicagotribune.com/questionnaire/primary-education/ | title = Primary: Education | work = On the Issues: Candidates for Governor | date = 2010-01-11 | work = [[Chicago Tribune]] Election Center | publisher = [[Tribune Company]] | location = [[Chicago]] | accessdate = 2010-08-09 }} {{Dead link|date=September 2010|bot=H3llBot}}</ref>

===Employment===
Brady supports lowering Illinois' minimum wage from its current $8.25 per hour to match the federal minimum wage of $7.25.<ref>Chicago Tribune, Clout Street Brady supports lowering state minimum wage to match feds, June 25, 2010, http://newsblogs.chicagotribune.com/clout_st/2010/06/brady-supports-lowering-state-minimum-wage-to-match-feds.html</ref>  Brady has said that the minimum wage should be controlled by “market-forces”. “I think supply and demand in the marketplace determines the rate of minimum wage. I don't think governmental intrusion is as effective," said Brady.<ref>Pantagraph, Jan. 23, 2003 {{pn|date=October 2010}}</ref>{{pn|date=October 2010}} Brady has also called for a freeze in the state's minimum wage until the lower federal rate catches up to that in Illinois.<ref>Chicago Tribune, Hendon opens for Quinn, calls Brady racist, sexist, October 24, 2010, page 8</ref>

===Death penalty===
Brady intends to lift the [[moratorium]] on the [[Capital punishment in the United States|death penalty]] if he becomes governor.<ref name="trib-2010q-social">{{Cite news| url = http://elections.chicagotribune.com/questionnaire/primary-social-issues/ | title = Primary: Social Issues | work = On the Issues: Candidates for Governor | date = 2010-01-26 | work = [[Chicago Tribune]] Election Center | publisher = [[Tribune Company]] | location = [[Chicago]] | accessdate = 2010-08-09 }} {{Dead link|date=September 2010|bot=H3llBot}}</ref>

===Abortion===
Bill Brady self-identifies as [[pro-life]]. He supports a ban on all abortions, including in cases of [[rape]] and [[incest]].  He makes an exception and allows abortion when a mother's life is at risk.<ref>Brady for Illinois, ''Chicago Tribune'', Jan 22, 2010, http://bradyforillinois.com/2010/01/22/profile-illinois-state-sen-bill-brady-runs-for-the-gop-nomination-for-governor/</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/elections/ct-met-brady-quinn-governor-20100306,0,4386468.story |title=Bill Brady finds himself standing in a harsher light |publisher=Chicago Tribune |date=2007-01-07 |accessdate=2010-07-30 | first=Rick | last=Pearson}}</ref><ref>Chicago Tribune, Illinois governors race,Sen Bill Brady accepts GOP Nomination, March 5, 2010, http://articles.chicagotribune.com/2010-03-05/news/ct-met-gop-governor-race-20100305_1_gop-illinois-state-board-jobs</ref> He has also backed legislation allowing pharmacists refuse to dispense emergency contraception.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.pantagraph.com/news/state-and-regional/illinois/article_05a1a8b2-de6b-11df-aaa4-001cc4c002e0.html |title=Voting history offers little insight on Brady
|publisher=Bloomington Pantagraph |date=2010-10-23 |accessdate=2010-10-23 }}</ref>

===LGBT issues===
A week after winning the Republican primary, Brady introduced a proposed state [[constitutional amendment]] on February 10, 2010<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.ilga.gov/legislation/fulltext.asp?DocName=&SessionId=76&GA=96&DocTypeId=SJRCA&DocNum=0095&GAID=10&LegID=51491&SpecSess=&Session= |title=Illinois General Assembly - Full Text of SJRCA0095 |publisher=Ilga.gov |date=2002-04-17 |accessdate=2010-07-30}}</ref> defining marriage as between "one man and one woman".<ref>Chicago Sun Times, Ban gay marriages, republican hopeful says so, Feb 12, 2010, http://www.suntimes.com/news/elections/2042403,CST-NWS-brady11.article</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2010/02/11/bill-brady-wants-to-chang_n_458155.html |title=Bill Brady Wants To Change Illinois Constitution To Ban Gay Marriage |publisher=Huffingtonpost.com |date= |accessdate=2010-07-30}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/shawn-healy/gay-marriage-and-the-gove_b_474853.html |title=Shawn Healy: Gay Marriage and the Governor's Race |publisher=Huffingtonpost.com |date= |accessdate=2010-07-30}}</ref><ref name="sjrca0095">{{Cite web|url=http://www.ilga.gov/legislation/fulltext.asp?DocName=&SessionId=76&GA=96&DocTypeId=SJRCA&DocNum=95&GAID=10&LegID=51491&SpecSess=&Session= |title=Illinois General Assembly - Full Text of SJRCA0095 |publisher=Ilga.gov |date=2002-04-17 |accessdate=2010-07-30}}</ref>  The proposed constitutional amendment would also deny validity and recognition to any "uniting of persons of the same sex in a civil union, domestic partnership, or other similar same sex relationship."<ref name="sjrca0095"/>  Although Brady was originally the main sponsor of the amendment, its chief sponsor is now Illinois State Senator [[John O. Jones]], who became co-sponsor with Brady the week following its submission.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.ilga.gov/legislation/BillStatus.asp?DocNum=0095&GAID=10&DocTypeID=SJRCA&LegID=51491&SessionID=76&SpecSess=&Session=&GA=96 |title=Illinois General Assembly - Bill Status for SJRCA0095 |publisher=Ilga.gov |date= |accessdate=2010-08-29}}</ref>  Brady has stated that he is "concerned that activist judges could overturn our current law protecting this institution".<ref name="trib-2010q-social"/> Brady has also stated his opposition to civil unions for gay couples on more than one occasion.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.advocate.com/News/Daily_News/2010/10/06/Ill__Candidate_No_Civil_Unions/|title=Ill. Candidate: No Civil Unions|publisher=advocate.com |date= |accessdate=2010-10-00}}</ref>

===Stem cell research===
Brady voted against legislation that would authorize state funding for embryonic [[stem cell research]] but prohibit [[human cloning]].  The legislation passed.<ref>Project Vote Smart, accessed March 1, 2010,  http://www.votesmart.org/issue_keyvote_detail.php?cs_id=11831&can_id=6303</ref>

===Health insurance===
Brady voted against extending parental [[health insurance]] to unmarried dependents. The legislation later passed.<ref>Project Vote Smart, accessed March 1, 2010, http://www.votesmart.org/issue_keyvote_detail.php?cs_id=21986&can_id=6303</ref>

Brady co-sponsored SB 908 – Insurance Without Mandated Coverage - in 2003. SB 908 would have allowed insurance providers to offer plans that do not include coverage otherwise mandated in Illinois law.{{fact|date=October 2010}}  He voted NO on HB 211 in 2003 – Contraceptive Coverage in Private Health Insurance. HB 211, which became law in 2003,{{fact|date=October 2010}} required any private insurance plan that covered prescription drugs and devices to also cover FDA approved contraceptive drugs and devices, but expressly states that nothing in it requires the coverage of abortion services.{{fact|date=October 2010}}

Brady has called for cuts to the state’s Medicaid program, where he says his proposed forensic audit would reveal fraud, mismanagement and abuse. He also favors switching many Medicaid patients to a managed care system – the type currently administered by many Health Management Organizations (HMOs) – to control the cost of health care.<ref>The cost of Bill Brady’s plan, http://www.illinoistimes.com/Springfield/article-7884-the-cost-of-bill-bradyrss-plan.html</ref>

===Drugs===
Brady opposes the legalization of marijuana in Illinois.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.pantagraph.com/news/local/article_002ceea8-f90d-11de-81c3-001cc4c03286.html |title=Gubernatorial candidates split on medical marijuana bill |publisher=Pantagraph.com |date=2010-01-04 |accessdate=2010-07-30}}</ref>

===Gun rights===
Brady has stated that he is opposed to any further restrictions to the ownership of firearms in Illinois. He is also for legalizing [[concealed carry]], which would allow a law-abiding, licensed Illinois resident to carry a handgun or other weapon in public in a concealed manner.<ref name="trib-2010q-social"/><ref>Ill. gubernatorial candidates on guns Dec. 12, 2009 http://www.wandtv.com/Global/story.asp?S=11666917</ref>

===Ethics===
Brady's campaign website states that his administration would be a "clean break" from the ethics scandals of past governors.  He supports capping individual campaign contributions at $4,800 for each election cycle and prohibiting union and corporate contributions.<ref name="campgn-site-ethics">Brady for Illinois Jul. 24, 2010 http://www.bradyforillinois.com/issues/clean-break-ethics/</ref>

Brady has opposed requiring campaign contributors to list their occupations. He also dismissed adopting detailed federal-style statements of economic interest for public officials in Illinois as an "overreaction."<ref name="brady-undr-scrut">Republican governor nominee Bill Brady under greater scrutiny Mar. 6, 2010 http://newsblogs.chicagotribune.com/clout_st/2010/03/republican-governor-nominee-bill-brady-under-greater-scrutiny.html</ref>

===Term limits===
Brady has called for term limits in Illinois. He would limit legislators to five terms in the House and three terms in the Senate.<ref>Local Elections - Bill Brady, Candidate for Governor of Illinois http://abclocal.go.com/wls/feature?section=news/politics/local_elections&id=7206465</ref>

===Taxes===
Brady has opposed efforts to raise state sales and income tax rates in Illinois. He favors reducing [[sales tax]]es that he claims drive retail jobs and businesses to other states. He favors dedicating a percentage of Illinois revenue to property tax relief{{Clarify|date=August 2010}} and eliminating the [[estate tax]] in Illinois.{{Citation needed|date=August 2010}}

=== Animal welfare ===
Brady sponsored a bill that would allow the mass [[euthanasia]] of [[dogs]] and [[cats]].  After it received considerable criticism, he retracted his sponsorship and now has said that he would veto any such bill.<ref>Illinois General Assembly website, accessed Oct 20 2010, http://www.ilga.gov/legislation/billstatus.asp?DocNum=2999&GAID=10&GA=96&DocTypeID=SB&LegID=50273&SessionID=76</ref><ref>Chicago Sun-Times, Brady Backs Further Away From Euthanizing Animals, Oct  19 2010, http://www.suntimes.com/news/elections/2814866,CST-NWS-campaign19.article</ref>

title: Communism
creator: Conversion script
added_lines: In the 20th and 21st centuries democratic elections led to communist, and communist inspired, governments being elected in other parts of the world such as in [[Chile]] and [[Venezuela]]. Today, although communism is a less influential political force compared to what it was in much of the twentieth century,<ref>[[#Hol09|Holmes 2009]]. p. xii.</ref>  there are still powerful communist and aligned socialist movements in many parts of the world, especially southern Asia and South America, and since the [[economic crisis of 2008]] there has been a resurgence of interest in communist theory, especially the theories of Karl Marx.

Today, although communism is a less influential political force compared to what it was in much of the twentieth century,<ref>[[#Hol09|Holmes 2009]]. p. xii.</ref>  there are still powerful communist and aligned socialist movements in many parts of the world, especially southern Asia and South America, and since the [[Economic crisis of 2008]] there has been a resurgence of interest in communist theory, especially the theories of Karl Marx.

title: Jwala_Gutta
creator: Sb0302
added_lines: During her Badminton career, Jwala Gutta fell in love with fellow Badminton Player [[Chetan Anand (badminton)|Chetan Anand]], who was the 1999 Junior National Badminton Champion and 2003, 2007, 2008, 2010 Senior National Badminton Champion, and has been honored with an Arjuna Award. The couple married on 17 July 2005.More recently, there were rumours wide spread regarding her extra-marital affair to [[Mohammad Azharuddin|Mohd. Azharuddin]] a well known cricket personality and currently serving as a Member of Parliament. Though both denied the rumours, it gained wide publicity as the couple was sighted together a number of times and more because of the internal conflict between Azharuddin and his wife, ex-bollywood actor [[Sangeeta Bijlani]] who are reportedly been found living apart.<ref>{{citation|url=http://www.hindu.com/2005/07/18/stories/2005071814681800.htm|date=2005-07-18|accessdate=2010-09-29|title=Chetan Anand weds Gutta Jwala|first=V. title: DeSean_Jackson
creator: Reelectgore
added_lines: l
deleted_lines:
==College career==
[[Image:DeSeanJackson.jpg|thumb|Jackson in 2006 matched up against [[Washington State Cougars football|Washington State]] strong safety [[Eric Frampton]]]]

Wearing the number 1, in his first collegiate game against [[Sacramento State#Athletics|Sacramento State]] in [[2005 California Golden Bears football team|2005]], Jackson scored both an offensive and special teams touchdown, returning a punt 49 yards for a score.  Throughout his freshman season, Jackson picked up 38 receptions for 601 yards along with seven touchdowns, eclipsing the 100-yard mark three times. In the [[2005 Las Vegas Bowl]] game against [[BYU Cougars football|BYU]], Jackson tallied 130 yards and two scores.

Coming into his sophomore year with high expectations, Jackson displayed more of his talent and playmaking ability, tallying 1,060 receiving yards and nine touchdowns. Jackson also returned four punts for touchdowns. He earned first-team All-[[Pac-10]] honors as both a punt returner and a wide receiver.  Jackson garnered national recognition with selections to first-team [[2006 College Football All-America Team|All-America]] by the ''[[Associated Press]]'', [[Walter Camp Football Foundation]], the [[Football Writers Association of America]], the ''[[Sporting News]]'' and ''[[Rivals.com]]'' as a punt returner. Jackson also captured the inaugural [[Randy Moss Award]] as the top return man in the nation.  In one of only two California losses in Pac-10 play, Jackson had a 95-yard punt return for a touchdown against [[Arizona Wildcats|Arizona]].<ref name="Going NFL Draft"/>

Jackson entered his junior season being considered a [[Heisman Trophy]] candidate.  His season began promisingly, with a 77-yard punt return for a touchdown against [[Tennessee Volunteers football|Tennessee]] in the opening game of the season.<ref name="Going NFL Draft"/> Against eleventh-ranked [[2007 Oregon Ducks football team|Oregon]], he caught 11 passes for 161 yards and two touchdowns to lead the Bears to their first victory in [[Autzen Stadium]] since 1987. Jackson finished the [[2007 California Golden Bears football team|2007 season]] with 65 catches for 762 yards, and scored six touchdowns as a receiver. Jackson was named an [[2007 College Football All-America Team|All-American]] as a return specialist.<ref name="Going NFL Draft"/> Jackson suffered several minor injuries that limited his effectiveness at times during the season, along with a right [[thigh]] injury that forced him to miss most of the game against [[Washington Huskies football|Washington]] and the [[Big Game (football)|Big Game]] against [[Stanford Cardinal football|Stanford]].<ref>{{cite news |author=Ratto, Ray |title=Stanford believed it had Cal's number |url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2007/12/02/SPHKTMUL5.DTL |work=[[San Francisco Chronicle]] |date=December 2, 2007 |accessdate=2010-10-12}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |author=Simmons, Rusty and Michelle Smith |title=Cal's Jackson uncertain for action Saturday |url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2007/11/29/SPFKTKGMR.DTL |work=[[San Francisco Chronicle]] |date=November 29, 2007 |accessdate=2010-10-12}}</ref>  He also missed the first quarter of the [[2007 Armed Forces Bowl]] for violating undisclosed team rules.<ref>{{cite news |author=Hawkins, Stephen |title=Cal receivers lead spectacular rally |url=http://seattletimes.nwsource.com/html/collegesports/2004102268_cal01.html |work=[[Seattle Times]] |date=January 1, 2008 |accessdate=2010-10-12}}</ref>

Jackson left Cal following the 2007 season, declaring for the [[2008 NFL Draft]]. He departed holding [[Pac-10]] records for punts returned for a touchdown both in a season (four), and in a career (six). Jackson ranks third all-time at California for receiving yards with 2,423 and receiving touchdowns with 22.  He is sixth in receptions (162). Jackson finished with 52 career plays of 20 yards or more, making up 23 percent of his 226 touches.<ref name="Going NFL Draft">{{cite news |author=Simmons, Rusty |title=Jackson Leaving Cal For NFL |url=http://www.sfgate.com/flat/archive/2008/01/15/chronicle/archive/2008/01/15/SPU3UFNOU.html?tsp=1 |work=[[San Francisco Chronicle]] |date=January 15, 2008 |accessdate=2010-10-12}}</ref>

title: Ron_Johnson_(businessman)
creator: Psantora
added_lines: Under Johnson's direction, Apple's retail stores achieved a record level of growth, exceeding a billion dollars in annual sales within two years of their debut, besting the previous record set by [[Gap (clothing retailer)|The Gap]].  Apple today operates over 300 stores, including outlets in Australia, Canada, China, France, Germany, Italy, Switzerland, The United Kingdom, The United States, and Japan.<ref>http://www.apple.com/retail/storelist/</ref>  Apple is expanding their retail presence aggressively, and is expected to open a store in Berlin and Barcelona in the near future.

title: Chuck_Versus_the_First_Fight
creator: Jackerr11
added_lines:
Chuck and Tuttle wake up on board a private airplane where Dasha begins to interrogate them using torture. Eventually a fight breaks out between Chuck and Volkoff's henchmen. Despite Tuttle's bumbling personality, the two are able to escape by parachuting out of the airplane. Chuck wakes up to find Tuttle has hitched them a ride back to Los Angeles in a truck loaded with sheep.
They arrive at a bank where Tuttle retrieves a package that will prove Mary Bartowski's innocence. Just as Sarah arrives with Chuck's mother, so do Dasha and Volkoff's henchmen. Confronting each other for the first time since the incident that spurred their fight, Chuck and Sarah argue while sneaking around the bank from the Volkoff henchmen. Chuck and Sarah resolve their fight while fighting off Volkoff's men. However, Dasha fires a shot at Chuck and Tuttle jumps in the way to take the bullet. Bleeding, Tuttle gives Chuck a triangular-shaped disk that requires a specific, defunct computer to use it, one of which is in London. Fortunately, Chuck's father has the same computer in the secret basement that contains all of his research.
Sarah, Chuck, and Mary head to the old Bartowski home to retrieve the files off the disk. However, when Casey and Morgan arrive at the bank, they find Tuttle has disappeared leaving behind only a pool of blood. Chuck inserts the disk into his father's computer, but the disk turns out to be empty. While attempting to ask why the disk is empty, Chuck is forced by his mother to view a video on her portable device that causes him to lose the ability to [[The Intersect#"Flashes"|flash]]. Tuttle walks into the basement and reveals to Chuck and Sarah that he is really Alexei Volkoff, the mastermind behind Volkoff Industries. Mary ties Chuck and Sarah up and Volkoff lays bombs around the basement while explaining to Chuck that his father wasted his life and research on a woman who truly was a rogue agent.
As Volkoff and Mary leave the basement, Mary slips Sarah a razor and whispers to her to keep Chuck safe. After Volkoff and Mary leave, Sarah cuts herself and Chuck loose and they rush out of the old Bartowski home before the bomb detonates. Chuck watches in disappointment as he cannot use the Intersect and all of his father's research has been destroyed.

They arrive at a bank where Tuttle retrieves a package that will prove Mary Bartowski's innocence. Just as Sarah arrives with Chuck's mother, so do Dasha and Volkoff henchmen. Confronting each other for the first time since the incident that spurred their fight, Chuck and Sarah argue while sneaking around the bank from the Volkoff henchmen. Chuck and Sarah resolve their fight while fighting off Volkoff's men. However, Dasha fires a shot at Chuck and Tuttle jumps in the way to take the bullet. Bleeding, Tuttle gives Chuck a triangular-shaped disk that requires a specific, defunct computer to use it, one of which is in London. Fortunately, Chuck's father has the same computer in the secret basement that contains all of his research.
Sarah, Chuck, and Mary head to old Bartowski home to retrieve the files off the disk. However, when Casey and Morgan arrive at the bank, they find Tuttle has disappeared leaving only a pool of blood at the place where he was shot. Chuck inserts the disk into his father's computer, but the disk turns out to be empty. While attempting to ask why the disk is empty, Chuck is forced by his mother to view a video on her portable device that causes him to lose the ability to [[The Intersect#"Flashes"|flash]]. Tuttle walks into the basement and reveals to Chuck and Sarah that he is really Alexei Volkoff, the mastermind behind Volkoff Industries. Mary ties Chuck and Sarah up and Volkoff lays bombs around the basement while explaining to Chuck that his father wasted his life and research on a woman who truly was a rogue agent.
As Volkoff and Mary leave the basement, Mary slips Sarah a razor and whispers to her to keep her son safe. After Volkoff and Mary leave, Sarah cuts herself and Chuck loose and they rush out of the old Bartowski home before the bomb detonates. Chuck watches in disappointment as he cannot use the Intersect and all of his father's research has been destroyed.

title: Harrison_Bergeron
creator: The Anome
added_lines: In 2009, Hollywood veterans [[Julie Hagerty]], [[James Cosmo]], Academy Award nominee [[Patricia Clarkson]], and [[Armie Hammer]] starred in a film adaptation of "Harrison Bergeron" directed by Chandler Tuttle. The film was entitled ''[[2081 (film)|2081]]'' and premiered at the [[Seattle International Film Festival]]. Unlike the 1995 movie, the film version is a close adaptation of Vonnegut's story. The main speech by Harrison Bergeron reflects the spirit of rebellion from the original story but differs in that the lead character doesn't claim to be the "emperor of the world."  The film was released on January 25, 2010.

title: Gene_Taylor_(Mississippi_politician)
creator: Acsenray
added_lines: '''Gary Eugene "Gene" Taylor''' (born September 17, 1953) is the [[United States House of Representatives|U.S. Representative]] for {{ushr|MS|4}}, serving since 1989. He was defeated for re-election in the Republican tidal wave of 2010 by state Rep. Steven Palazzo, who gained 52% of the vote compared to Taylor's 47%. He will leave office in January 2011. He is a member of the [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic Party]]. The district, numbered as the 5th District from 1989 to 2003, takes in most of Mississippi's share of the [[Gulf Coast of the United States|Gulf Coast]] and includes [[Biloxi, Mississippi|Biloxi]], [[Gulfport, Mississippi|Gulfport]], [[Pascagoula, Mississippi|Pascagoula]], [[Laurel, Mississippi|Laurel]] and [[Hattiesburg, Mississippi|Hattiesburg]].

title: Shinya_Aoki
creator: Matsune
added_lines:
After the purchase of Pride by Zuffa LLC, most Japanese fighters signed to newly created mixed martial arts promotions with Aoki signing to [[Dream (mixed martial arts)|Dream]].  Here Aoki finally faced Cavalcante on March 15, 2008 at the opening round of the Dream Lightweight Grand Prix tournament. Early in the first round, the referee stopped the action when Cavalcante apparently landed illegal elbow strikes to the back of Aoki's neck. The ringside doctor announced that Aoki was unable to continue due to the injury and Cavalcante apologized for the incident.<ref>[http://www.mmaweekly.com/absolutenm/templates/dailynews.asp?articleid=5901 Dream 1 REVIEW: JZ VS. AOKI A NO CONTEST] by Monty DiPietro (March 15, 2008)</ref>  The fight resulted in a no contest. Elbow strikes to the neck and spine area are illegal under Dream rules. Aoki was later found to have sustained concussion of the cervical vertebra.<ref>[http://www.sherdog.com/news/news.asp?n_id=12599 Aoki's Grand Prix Bout Postponed] by Tim Leidecker, Sherdog News. May 5, 2008</ref>

They had their rematch at [[Dream 2]] on April 29, 2008. title: Headphones
creator: Prometheus~enwiki
added_lines: '''Earbuds''' or '''earphones''' are headphones of a much smaller size that are placed directly outside of the ear canal, but without fully enveloping it. They are generally inexpensive and are favored for their portability and convenience. Due to their inability to provide any isolation they are often used at higher volumes in order to drown out noise from the user's surroundings, which increases the risk of [[Hearing impairment|hearing-loss]].<ref>[http://www.ear-hearing.com/pt/re/earhearing/abstract.00003446-200412000-00001.htm Ear and Hearing - Abstract: Volume 25(6) December 2004 p 513-527 Output Levels of Commercially Available Portable Compact Disc Players and the Potential Risk to Hearing]</ref> During the 1990s and 2000s, earbuds became a common type bundled with personal music devices.

added_lines: The '''2010 United States Senate election in Pennsylvania''' took place on November 2, 2010, during the [[United States elections, 2010|2010 midterm elections]]. The race features [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democrat]] [[Joe Sestak]] against [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican party]] candidate [[Pat Toomey]]. Incumbent [[United States Senate|U.S. Senator]] [[Arlen Specter]] ran for re-election after leaving the [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican Party]] in April 2009 to become a Democrat,<ref name=cnn090428>{{Cite news|url=http://www.cnn.com/2009/POLITICS/04/28/specter.party.switch/index.html |title=Longtime GOP Sen. Arlen Specter becomes Democrat |publisher=CNN.com |date=2009-04-28 |accessdate=2010-05-19}}</ref> but lost in the Democratic primary to [[Joe Sestak]]. Former U.S. Congressman [[Pat Toomey]] defeated perennial candidate [[Peg Luksik]] for the Republican nomination.

added_lines: '''Dimethylmercury''' (([[Carbon|C]][[Hydrogen|H]]<sub>3</sub>)<sub>2</sub>[[Mercury (element)|Hg]]) is an [[organomercury compound]]. This colorless liquid is one of the strongest known [[neurotoxin]]s. It is described as having a slightly sweet smell, although inhaling enough vapor to detect its odor would be hazardous.

title: Terracotta_Army
creator: Olivier
added_lines: The terracotta figures are life-like and life-sized.  They vary in height, uniform and hairstyle in accordance with rank.  The colored lacquer finish, individual facial features, and actual weapons and armor from battle used in manufacturing these figures created a realistic appearance.  The original weapons were stolen by robbers shortly after the creation of the army and the coloring has faded greatly.  However, their existence serves as a testament to the amount of labor and skill involved in their construction.  It also reveals the powerSSSSSSS the First Emperor possessed, enabling him to command such a monumental undertaking.

title: WSHM-LD
creator: Boothy443
added_lines: In November 2003, the channel was re-launched as '''WSHM-LP''' and it took WFSB's spot on most Massachusetts cable systems. Prior to WSHM's launch, WFSB had been the default CBS affiliate for the Springfield/Holyoke [[media market|market]] since joining the network in 1958. It blocked several attempts by that city's original CBS affiliate, [[WGGB-TV]], to switch from [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]] to CBS. WFSB still buys syndicated programming for the Hartford/[[New Haven, Connecticut|New Haven]] and the Springfield/Holyoke markets. In August 2006, WSHM redesigned its website and changed its logo from one resembling sister station [[KPHO]] to a logo resembling (but unrelated to) [[KYW-TV]] in [[Philadelphia]]. In April 2007, WSHM redesigned its website again.

title: Mitch_Daniels
added_lines: Although Daniels had claimed to be reluctant to seek higher office,<ref>{{YouTube|mC9WmB1PNVM|Mitch Daniels Indiana Governor "We Will"}}</ref> many media outlets, including [[Politico (newspaper)|Politico]], ''[[The Weekly Standard]]'', ''[[Forbes]]'', ''[[The Washington Post]]'', ''[[CNN]]'', ''[[The Economist]]'', and ''[[The Indianapolis Star]]'' had speculated that Daniels may be in position to seek the Republican nomination for President in 2012 after he joined the national debate on [[cap and trade]] legislation by penning a response in the ''[[Wall Street Journal]]'' to policies espoused by the Democratic-majority [[United States Congress|Congress]] and the [[White House]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://online.wsj.com/article/SB124234844782222081.html |date=15 May 2009 |title=Indiana Says 'No Thanks' to Cap and Trade  |author=Mitch Daniels | work=The Wall Street Journal}}</ref> The speculators have cited Daniels' record of reforming government, reducing taxes, balancing the budget, and connecting with voters in Indiana.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.politico.com/news/stories/0509/22634.html|title=The innovators of today's GOP|author=Lou Zickar|date=18 May 2009}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.forbes.com/2009/05/14/obama-republican-party-baby-boomer-opinions-columnists-mitch-daniels.html|title=The Future Of The GOP |author=Peter Robinson|date=15 May 2009|publisher=Forbes}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://voices.washingtonpost.com/thefix/eye-on-2012/can-mitch-daniels-save-the-gop.html#more|title=Can Mitch Daniels Save the GOP?|publisher=The Washington Post |author=Chris Cillizza|date=12 May2009}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.indystar.com/article/20090517/NEWS08/905170362/1101/NEWS08/How+do+Daniels++moves+add+up? |author=Matthew Tully|title=How do Daniels' moves add up? |date=17 May 2009}}</ref> In response to their speculation Daniels dismissed a presidential run in June 2009, saying "I've only ever run for or held one office. It's the last one I'm going to hold."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.realclearpolitics.com/politics_nation/2009/06/daniels_says_current_job_is_hi.html |date=3 June 2009|title=Daniels Ends 2012 Speculation|publisher=RealClearPolitics.com|accessdate=4 June 2009}}</ref> However, in February 2010 he told a ''Washington Post'' reporter that he was open to the idea of running in 2012.<ref>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Politics/monitor_breakfast/2010/0223/Mitch-Daniels-open-to-presidential-run-despite-100-reasons-to-pass</ref> Furthermore, an Indiana Governor can only be in office for eight years in any given twelve year period (See [[Governor of Indiana]]). This means when his second term as Governor ends in 2012, he will not be able to run for Governor again until 2016.

It's the last one I'm going to hold."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.realclearpolitics.com/politics_nation/2009/06/daniels_says_current_job_is_hi.html |date=3 June 2009|title=Daniels Ends 2012 Speculation|publisher=RealClearPolitics.com|accessdate=4 June 2009}}</ref> However, in February 2010 he told a ''Washington Post'' reporter that he was open to the idea of running in 2012.<ref>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Politics/monitor_breakfast/2010/0223/Mitch-Daniels-open-to-presidential-run-despite-100-reasons-to-pass</ref> Furthermore, an Indian Governor can only be in office for eight years in any given twelve year period (See [[Governor of Indiana]]). This means when his second term as Governor ends in 2012, he will not be able to run for Governor again until 2016.

title: Versailles,_Yvelines
creator: Conversion script
added_lines: Versailles is located 17.1 km (10.6 miles) west-southwest from the centre of Paris (as the crow flies). The city sits on an elevated plateau, 130 to 140 metres (425 to 460 ft) above sea-level (whereas the elevation of the centre of Paris is only 33 m (108 ft) above sea level), surrounded by wooded hills: in the north the forests of ''[[Forêt de Marly|Marly]]'' and Fausses-Reposes, and in the south the forests of Satory and [[Meudon]].
deleted_lines: Versailles is located 17.1 km near my house'(10.6 miles) west-southwest from the centre of Paris (as the crow flies). The city sits on an elevated plateau, 130 to 140 metres (425 to 460 ft) above sea-level (whereas the elevation of the centre of Paris is only 33 m (108 ft) above sea level), surrounded by wooded hills: in the north the forests of ''[[Forêt de Marly|Marly]]'' and Fausses-Reposes, and in the south the forests of Satory and [[Meudon]].

title: Carioca
added_lines: Slang words among youngsters from Rio de Janeiro include ''caraca!'' (gosh!) [now spread throughout Brazil], ''e aê?'' and ''qualé/quaé/coé?'' (whuzzup?), and ''maneiro'' (cool, fine, interesting, amusing) and ''sinistro'' (in Standard Portuguese, "sinister"; in slang, "awesome", "terrific", but also "terrible", "troublesome", "frightening", "weird"). Most of these slang words can be found in practically all of Brazil.

title: History_of_commercial_tobacco_in_the_United_States
creator: Tanner-Christopher
added_lines: During the 17th century, Europe had a growing demand for tobacco.  However, in areas of the American south, where tobacco grew well, capital was needed in order to grow this highly demanding crop.  These [[farmer]]s saw tobacco as merely a temporary crop to get them started until they could plant something else.  Their reasoning behind the temporary status given to tobacco had to do with low prices.  During the 17th century in [[Virginia]], tobacco was selling for [[Cent (United States coin)|pennies]] per pound.   Solutions to this problem came with [[slavery]].  Slavery had already existed in the colonies, but a new influx would greatly expand tobacco production.<ref>Gately, p. 110.</ref>
deleted_lines: During the 17th century, Europe had a growing demand for tobacco.  However, areas of the American south, where tobacco grew well, capital was needed in order to grow this highly demanding crop.  These [[farmer]]s saw tobacco as merely a temporary crop to get them started until they could plant something else.  Their reasoning behind the temporary status given to tobacco had to do with low prices.  During the 17th century in [[Virginia]], tobacco was selling for [[Cent (United States coin)|pennies]] per pound.   Solutions to this problem came with [[slavery]].  Slavery had already existed in the colonies, but a new influx would greatly expand tobacco production.<ref>Gately, p. 110.</ref>

}}'''Fletcher  Roy Christian''' [[MBE]]<ref>[http://www.aucklandleague.co.nz/display_page.asp?item=374 Otahuhu Rovers Rugby League Football and Sports Club Inc] at the [[Auckland Rugby League]] website</ref> is a New Zealand retired professional rubgy league footballer of the 1960s and 1970s. A centre three-quarter, he captained his country in the sport.
==Playing career==
Christian played his first Test match in 1965 against Australia. While playing for [[Otahuhu Leopards|Otahuhu]] in 1966 Christian was awarded the [[Auckland Rugby League club trophies|Lipscombe Cup]] for Premier One sportsman of the year. 

Christian was part of the [[Auckland rugby league team|Auckland side]] that defeated Australia in 1969.<ref>[http://www.aucklandleague.co.nz/display_page.asp?item=334 1969: Referee, and Kangaroos, crash] ''Auckland Rugby League''</ref> He was appointed captain of the New Zealand national side in 1970 and played in that year's [[1970 Rugby League World Cup|World Cup]].

title: Kurt_Hummel
creator: Frickative
added_lines: In "[[Never Been Kissed (Glee)|Never Been Kissed]]," Kurt goes to spy on Dalton Academy and meets gay student Blaine ([[Darren Criss]]). Kurt tells Blaine about being bullied, and Blaine convinces him to stand up for himself. Dave Karofsky shoves Kurt against his locker and Kurt follows him to confront him in the locker room. Karofsky becomes visibly upset and surprises Kurt by kissing him before running away, leaving Kurt in shock. Later Kurt and Blaine confront Karofsky, telling him that he has to stop and that he is not alone, but Karofsky denies he is gay and runs off. Karofsky also threatens to kill Kurt if he says anything about the kiss.
deleted_lines: In "[[Never Been Kissed (Glee)|Never Been Kissed]]," Kurt goes to spy on Dalton Academy and meets gay student Blaine ([[Darren Criss]]). Kurt tells Blaine about being bullied, and Blaine convinces him to stand up for himself. Dave Karofsky shoves Kurt against his locker and Kurt follows him to confront him in the locker room. Karofsky becomes visibly upset and surprises Kurt by kissing him before running away, leaving Kurt in shock. Later Kurt and Blaine confront Karofsky, telling him that he has to stop and that he is not alone, but Karofsky denies he is gay and runs off.

title: Tió_de_Nadal
creator: Jmabel
added_lines:
The '''''Tió de Nadal''''' (roughly "Christmas Log" or "Holiday Log"), also known as ''"Tió"'' (trunk or log, a big piece of cut wood) or ''"Tronca"'' ("log") and popularly called "Caga tió" (pooping or giving log in English), is a character in [[Catalan myths and legends|Catalan mythology]] relating to a Christmas tradition widespread in [[Catalonia]]. A similar tradition exists in other places such as the '''cachafuòc''' or '''soc de Nadal''' in [[Occitania]], or the '''''Tizón de Nadal''''' or '''''Tronca de Nabidá''''' in [[Aragon]], regions with a common history. |giving log,
give us treats,
give us sweets!
if you don't want to give,
I'll hit you with a stick,
give it up! |log, log,
giving log,
don't give us herrings,
they are too salty,
give us treats,
give us sweets!
deleted_lines: The '''''Tió de Nadal''''' (roughly "Christmas Log"), also known as ''"Tió"'' (trunk or log, a big piece of cut wood) or ''"Tronca"'' ("log") and popularly called "Caga tió" (pooping or defecating log in English), is a character in [[Catalan myths and legends|Catalan mythology]] relating to a Christmas tradition widespread in [[Catalonia]]. A similar tradition exists in other places such as the '''cachafuòc''' or '''soc de Nadal''' in [[Occitania]], or the '''''Tizón de Nadal''''' or '''''Tronca de Nabidá''''' in [[Aragon]], regions with a common history.

title: Question_mark
creator: Ant
added_lines: In [[computer programming]], the symbol "?" has a special meaning in many [[programming language]]s. In [[C (programming language)|C]]-descended languages, "?" is part of the '''[[?:]]''' operator, which is used to evaluate simple [[Boolean domain|boolean conditions]]. In [[C Sharp (programming language)|C#]] 2.0, the "?" modifier and the "??" operator are used to handle [[Nullable type|nullable data types]]. In the [[POSIX]] syntax for [[regular expression]]s, such as the one used in [[Perl]] and [[Python (programming language)|Python]], '''?''' stands for "zero or one instance of the previous subexpression", i.e. an optional element. In certain implementations of the [[BASIC]] programming language, the "?" character may be used as a shorthand for the "print" function. In [[OCaml]], the question mark precedes the label for an optional parameter. In [[Scheme (programming language)|Scheme]], as a convention, symbol names ending in ? are used for predicates such as odd?, null?, and eq?.
deleted_lines: In [[computer programming]], the symbol "?" has a special meaning in many [[programming language]]s. In [[C (programming language)|C]]-descended languages, "?" is part of the '''[[?:]]''' operator, which is used to evaluate simple [[Boolean domain|boolean conditions]]. In [[C Sharp (programming language)|C#]] 2.0, the "?" modifier and the "??" operator are used to handle [[Nullable type|nullable data types]]. In the [[POSIX]] syntax for [[regular expression]]s, such as the one used in [[Perl]] and [[Python (programming language)|Python]], '''?''' stands for "zero or one instance of the previous subexpression", i.e. an optional element. In certain implementations of the [[BASIC]] programming language, the "?" character may be used as a shorthand for the "print" function. In [[OCaml]], the question mark precedes the label for an optional parameter.

comment: Elaborated on legal delegation of authority issues posed by unilateral TSA policy.
title: John_S._Pistole
creator: Geo Swan
added_lines: However, this is unlikely given the totalitarian stance taken by the TSA and their unwillingness to do so. In fact local TSA on "national opt-out day" has requested local police departments to be on hand to arrest and bully those who exercise their rights and opt out before any search has taken place. <ref name="TSA: Travelers Who Refuse Scanning Can’t Leave">[http://news.antiwar.com/2010/11/19/tsa-travelers-who-refuse-scanning-cant-leave-will-be-fined/],</ref>  This too violates the constitutional rationale behind not requiring a warrant in the first place. Contrary to threats by TSA agents, civil penalties do not exist nor can they for refusing to be searched once a person has entered the checkpoint, rather fines exist for interfering with a search once it has started. Further, as the TSA adopted AIT screening expressly without Congressional appropriation or authorization, it remains unclear whether TSA agents have even nominal authority or legal protection for "enhanced" pat-downs in support of the machines; [[U.S. Congressman Ron Paul]] has sought to explicitly declare that they do not through legislation.

title: Dragon_Ball
creator: Vicarious
added_lines:
An episode of Dragon Ball Z is known to be the source of the popular phrase "It's [[Over 9000!]]". this later became an internet meme.


=="Over 9000!" Internet Meme==
On an episode of Dragon Ball Z, [[Nappa]] questions [[Vegeta]] regarding [[Goku]]'s power level. As soon as he checks the Scouter, a device used to detect power levels in an individual, [[Vegeta]] angrily replies "IT'S OVER 9000!", crushing the Scouter in his hand. this episode later became the source of the [[internet meme]] "Over 9000!", used to express large quantities.

In the original Japanese dub of the series, and in both the Japanese and English language mangas, Vegeta states that Goku’s level is actually “over 8000.”

On October 17th, 2006, 4Channer/Youtube user Kajetokun uploaded the video “9000!! NINE THOUSAAAAANDD!” The video had over five million views. On June 2010, the video had been removed and the user suspended. 
In June 2008, the video was reuploaded with over a million views.

The phrase adopted from Dragon Ball Z is now used when talking about a relatively large amount.

title: Security_theater
creator: Mozzerati
added_lines: While it may seem that security theater must always cause loss, it may actually be beneficial, at least in a localised situation.  This is because ''perception'' of security is sometimes more important than security itself.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://news.cnet.com/8301-13512_3-9915030-23.html|title=Bruce Schneier's new view on Security Theater|author=Peter N. Glaskowsky|date=2008-04-09|accessdate=2009-07-22}}</ref>  If the potential victims of an attack feel more protected and safer as a result of the measures, then they may carry on activities they would have otherwise avoided.  In addition, if the security measures in place appear effective, potential attackers may be dissuaded from proceeding or may direct their attention to a target perceived as less secure. Unsophisticated adversaries in particular may be frightened by superficial impressions of security (such as seeing multiple people in uniform or observing cameras) and not even attempt to find weaknesses or determine effect.

title: The_finger
added_lines:
The above description is not accurate, i can't edit it though!

In england, the single finger insult is used to tell people to fuck off.

People often get this and the V sign confused as the V sign stands for encouraging Victory when the palm is facing the person you are communicating with, as used by Winston Churchill during the World Wars.

The inverse V (i.e. with the palm hidden) is showing your lack of support in an offensive way i.e. "fuck off", however,  it is a statement of wishing others to lose.

title: Fleischkuekle
creator: Alexwcovington
added_lines: This dish is a local favorite. Primarily made in the Beulah, Hazen and Zap (B-H-Z) and close surrounding areas, it has gained popularity in just the last 15 years in areas around the state such as Bismarck and Fargo. Some restaurants in Fargo serve this delight with a brown gravy, which is not popular in the B-H-Z areas, where pickles and ketchup are usually the only other condiments on the table. Some people opt for a slice of cheese, but this is not traditional either. It is advised that the hot grease inside the Fleishkuechle is drained before eating.

Some of the younger folks opt for a slice of cheese, but this is not traditional either. Be sure to drain the hot grease inside the Fleishkuechle before you take your first bite!

title: Erwin_Schrödinger
creator: Conversion script
added_lines:
In 1914 Erwin Schrödinger achieved [[Habilitation]] (''venia legendi''). Between 1914 and 1918 he participated in war work as a commissioned officer in the Austrian fortress artillery ([[Gorizia]], [[Duino]], [[Sistiana]], Prosecco, Vienna). On 6 April 1920, Schrödinger married Annemarie Bertel. The same year, he became the assistant to [[Max Wien]], in [[Jena]], and in September 1920 he attained the position of ao. Prof. (''Ausserordentlicher Professor''), roughly equivalent to Reader (UK) or associate professor (US), in [[Stuttgart]]. In 1921, he became o. Prof. (''Ordentlicher Professor'', i.e. full professor), in [[Breslau University|Breslau]] (now [[Wrocław]], Poland).

In 1921, he moved to the [[University of Zurich|University of Zürich]]. In January 1926, Schrödinger published in ''[[Annalen der Physik]]'' the paper "''Quantisierung als Eigenwertproblem''" [''tr''. Quantization as an [[Eigenvalue]] Problem] on wave mechanics and what is now known as the [[Schrödinger equation]]. In this paper he gave a "derivation" of the wave equation for time independent systems, and showed that it gave the correct energy eigenvalues for the [[hydrogen-like atom]]. This paper has been universally celebrated as one of the most important achievements of the twentieth century, and created a revolution in quantum mechanics, and indeed of all physics and chemistry. A second paper was submitted just four weeks later that solved the [[quantum harmonic oscillator]], the [[rigid rotor]] and the [[diatomic molecule]], and gives a new derivation of the Schrödinger equation. A third paper in May showed the equivalence of his approach to that of Heisenberg and gave the treatment of the [[Stark effect]]. A fourth paper in this most remarkable series showed how to treat problems in which the system changes with time, as in [[scattering]] problems. These papers were the central achievement of his career and were at once recognized as having great significance by the physics community.

In 1927, he succeeded [[Max Planck]] at the [[Humboldt University of Berlin|Friedrich Wilhelm University]] in Berlin. In 1933, however, Schrödinger decided to leave Germany; he disliked the Nazis' [[anti-semitism]]. He became a Fellow of [[Magdalen College, Oxford|Magdalen College]] at the [[University of Oxford]]. Soon after he arrived, he received the [[Nobel Prize]] together with [[Paul Dirac|Paul Adrien Maurice Dirac]]. His position at Oxford did not work out; his unconventional personal life (Schrödinger lived with two women)<ref>Walter J. Moore. Schrödinger, life and thought, 278 ff.</ref> was not met with acceptance. In 1934, Schrödinger lectured at [[Princeton University]]; he was offered a permanent position there, but did not accept it. Again, his wish to set up house with his wife and his mistress may have posed a problem. {{Citation needed|date=March 2010}} He had the prospect of a position at the [[University of Edinburgh]] but visa delays occurred, and in the end he took up a position at the [[University of Graz]] in Austria in 1936.

In the midst of these tenure issues in 1935, after extensive correspondence with personal friend [[Albert Einstein]], he proposed the [[Schrödinger's cat]] [[thought experiment]].

comment: /* Differences between the films and the novel */
title: Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows_–_Part_1
creator: Stevenjones1112
added_lines: With the story's expansion into two films, ''Deathly Hallows'' is to be the most faithful adaptation to its source.  However, there are a number of differences between the book and the movie.  For example, in the book, Peter Pettigrew is killed by his own magically created hand for hesitating to kill Harry while Harry and his friends try to escape from Malfoy Manor, while at the end of ''Part 1'' it is believed Pettigrew survives.  The invisibility cloak is also conspicuously absent from the first half of the film, whereas it is used on numerous occasions in the corresponding chapters of the book, such as every time Harry, Ron, and Hermione move campsites. <ref>{{cite news|last=Rich|first=Katey|title=10 Big Differences Between The Harry Potter And The Deathly Hallows Book And Movie|url=http://www.cinemablend.com/new/10-Big-Differences-Between-The-Harry-Potter-And-The-Deathly-Hallows-Book-And-Movie-21819.html|accessdate=22 November 2010|newspaper=Cinema blend|date=19  November 2010}}</ref> Other differences include Hedwig dying of her own free will protecting Harry, rather than inside a cage.  Pius Thicknesse, who is Minister of Magic under Voldemort's command is acting under the imperius curse in the book, but apparently of his own free will in the movie.  Regulus Black's involvement with the locket horcrux is not explained by Kreacher as it is in the book. Also absent in Harry's departure from the Dursley's is a scene in which he and Dudley make up their past differences. <ref>{{cite news|last=Urban|first=Samantha|title=Harry Potter: Differences between the book and the movie|url=http://moviesblog.dallasnews.com/archives/2010/11/harry-potter-differences-betwe.html|accessdate=22 November 2010|newspaper=The Dallas Morning News|date=20 November 2010}}</ref>
